user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_add_response_footer:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN enum MHD_Result
MHD_add_response_footer (struct MHD_Response *response,
                         const char *footer,
                         const char *content)
{
  return add_response_entry (response,
                             MHD_FOOTER_KIND,
                             footer,
                             content);
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function MHD_add_response_footer:
static enum MHD_Result
add_response_entry (struct MHD_Response *response,
                    enum MHD_ValueKind kind,
                    const char *header,
                    const char *content)
{
  size_t header_len;
  size_t content_len;

  if (NULL == content)
    return MHD_NO;

  header_len = strlen (header);
  content_len = strlen (content);
  return add_response_entry_n (response, kind, header,
                               header_len, content,
                               content_len) ? MHD_YES : MHD_NO;
}
...
static bool
add_response_entry_n (struct MHD_Response *response,
                      enum MHD_ValueKind kind,
                      const char *header,
                      size_t header_len,
                      const char *content,
                      size_t content_len)
{
  if (NULL == response)
    return false;
  if (0 == header_len)
    return false;
  if (0 == content_len)
    return false;
  if (NULL != memchr (header, '\t', header_len))
    return false;
  if (NULL != memchr (header, ' ', header_len))
    return false;
  if (NULL != memchr (header, '\r', header_len))
    return false;
  if (NULL != memchr (header, '\n', header_len))
    return false;
  if (NULL != memchr (content, '\r', content_len))
    return false;
  if (NULL != memchr (content, '\n', content_len))
    return false;

  return MHD_add_response_entry_no_check_ (response, kind, header, header_len,
                                           content, content_len);
}
...
static bool
add_response_entry_n (struct MHD_Response *response,
                      enum MHD_ValueKind kind,
                      const char *header,
                      size_t header_len,
                      const char *content,
                      size_t content_len)
{
  if (NULL == response)
    return false;
  if (0 == header_len)
    return false;
  if (0 == content_len)
    return false;
  if (NULL != memchr (header, '\t', header_len))
    return false;
  if (NULL != memchr (header, ' ', header_len))
    return false;
  if (NULL != memchr (header, '\r', header_len))
    return false;
  if (NULL != memchr (header, '\n', header_len))
    return false;
  if (NULL != memchr (content, '\r', content_len))
    return false;
  if (NULL != memchr (content, '\n', content_len))
    return false;

  return MHD_add_response_entry_no_check_ (response, kind, header, header_len,
                                           content, content_len);
}
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
The provided code shows a call chain: MHD_add_response_footer -> add_response_entry -> add_response_entry_n -> MHD_add_response_entry_no_check_. To check for MISRA C Rule 17.2 (no direct or indirect recursion), these call sites and the definitions of the called functions must be investigated to ensure none call back into any caller in the chain. I therefore marked the wrapper (MHD_add_response_footer), the intermediate helper (add_response_entry), and the internal validator (add_response_entry_n) as suspicious fragments. The next function in the chain, MHD_add_response_entry_no_check_, is not provided here and must be inspected for possible calls back to any of the above; its call site is included in the flagged fragments so reviewers know to check it.

Other fragments in the provided code (strlen calls, the memchr checks, the NULL/length guards, and simple return values) do not indicate recursion and thus do not need investigation for Rule 17.2. There is no visible direct recursive call (a function calling itself) in the shown code. The only potential for indirect recursion would come from functions outside the shown fragments (notably MHD_add_response_entry_no_check_ or other functions it calls), which is why the call chain above is flagged for further review.
